idea-plugin.name: Quick Commands
idea-plugin.description:
Quick Commands - Execute terminal commands with a single click from your IDE toolbar.

Stop typing the same commands over and over. Quick Commands adds a dropdown menu to your Terminal toolbar, giving you instant access to your most-used commands like git pull, npm run dev, docker-compose up, or any custom script.

âœ¨ Key Features:
  • One-Click Execution - Run commands directly from the Terminal toolbar dropdown
  • Global Commands - Define commands that are available across all your projects
  • Project Commands - Set up project-specific commands stored in your project settings
  • Keyboard Shortcut - Quick access via Ctrl+Alt+T (customizable)
  • Simple Configuration - Easy-to-use settings UI under Tools > Quick Commands

  2. Add your commands (e.g., "Build" â†’ ./gradlew build)
  3. Click the âš¡ icon in the Terminal toolbar to run them

  • Build and run scripts (npm start, gradle build)
  • Git operations (git pull, git push)
  • Docker commands (docker-compose up -d)
  • Test runners (pytest, jest)
  • Any terminal command you use frequently

Supported IDEs: IntelliJ IDEA, PhpStorm, WebStorm, PyCharm, Android Studio, and all JetBrains IDEs (2024.2+)
